Name: Nicholas
Reviews: We stayed in this apartment for 4 weeks in July '19 and had a brilliant time. The main room of the apartment has a very well stocked kitchen with everything that we needed, even down to juicer, coffee machine, loads of pots and pans, everything. There is a small lounge area at the end with a TV and windows to the front and side, the sofa can be a sofa bed which is comfy enough as a bed. We didn't watch TV, but the wifi is good enough to stream video. The main room is large and very bright with two windows and three doors onto the terrace, although there are excellent shutters if you want it dark as well. There is aircon in the lounge that works really well on those especially hot days, although the weather in Riva is a lot milder than further south, more like 28c-33c Max most days. You do get a lot of thunderstorms though as it is in the mountains. By far my favourite part of the apartment is the huge terrace that looks out down the valley, you can't see the lake as it is probably 1.5km away but it is fabulous view. They have a flexible sail over some of the terrace that keeps the sun off and means you can use it come rain or shine. There are mosquitoes in Riva (like everywhere in Italy) so take some spray and use it in the evening. The bedroom is nice and big, with two singles pushed together as a double, you could have it as either, there is a moderate amount of storage although it was not an issue. The bathroom comes off the lounge and has a lovely dual head shower which works well as well as everything else you expect. Plenty of hot water. As a location, you probably need a car, it is 15 minutes to the lakeside where there are shops and restaurants, but another 25 mins from there into town. Alternatively you could walk into Riva on the roads in about 35 mins. There are buses from nearby but they are not frequent. There are two good local restaurants within a couple of hundred metres and a very useful little shop that is open from 7.30am-7pm (ish) and has excellent local bread of lots of varieties for breakfast on the terrace. They also sell milk, juice, drinks pasta etc but no fresh fruit or veg. There are two good supermarkets within a few miles. Riva is such a brilliant place, the best place to stay on Lake Garda, it has walks and cycling, sailing and windsurfing, canoeing on the lakes and in the river. You can walk on the flat in the valley or up the mountains. Day trips to Venice, Milan, Verona are possible if you don't mind a drive and the closer towns of Trento, Rovereto are worth a trip. The lake towns Malcesine etc can be visited by boat which is a fabulous day out. Roberto and family were all charming and very welcoming, they shared produce from the garden and leant us bikes, everything we needed for a perfect stay.

Name: Sandra
Reviews: Roberto and his family are wonderful and generous hosts. Check in was easy and communication throughout our entire stay was fast and easy. The apartment is large enough for 4-5 people. The Master bedroom offers a letto doppio (king size) and a twin pull out chair which was pretty comfortable for an adult. The living room offers a queen sized pull out sofa which was fairly comfortable. The living room/sleeping area is separated by waist hight storage cubicles which offers some privacy. The bathroom is brand new and sports the newest style with a large shower. The kitchen offered basically everything you need to prep a simple meal. The best part of the place is definitely the terrazza - large enough for a big dining table and 4 large lounge chairs. The sun sail offers shade during the hot summer months. Our kids were welcomed to play in the very large and luscious garden - we even got some fresh veggies and herbs form the family garden. The garden is beautiful but beware of the mosquitos. The view from the terrazza: overlooking the garden and part of the village. You can not see the lake but get a nice view of the surrounding mountains. From the apartment to the lake its about 10-15 minutes walk, downtown Riva 30-40 minutes. There is a tiny store close by where you can get bread, milk and a news paper. The next grocery store is about a 5 minutes with the car. The car can be parked on the premises (entirely fenced in) and bikes can be stored indoors. The internet was spotty on some days, but when it worked it worked very well. There is no air-condition (2 fans are provided) but during our stay in late July the nights cooled down enough to offer a refreshing breeze. The apartment is beautiful and sparkling clean with absolutely wonderful hosts. If you don't mind being outside of Riva or have a bike or a car than this is the place for you - quite and relaxing with a personal touch.

Wir waren das erste Mal am Gardasee und das Gefühl jmd. anrufen zu können der uns mit Rat und Tat zur Seite steht, ist unbezahlbar. Gelegen in einem wunderschönen Gebiet abseits vom Zentrum von Riva mit dörflichem Charakter, umgeben von Olivenbäumen. Angenehmer Fußweg zum Zentrum und See. Ein idealer Ort zum Entspannen und Ausruhen. Wir haben einen wunderbaren Urlaub verbracht und uns bei Roberto und seiner Familie sehr wohl und willkommen gefühlt! Sigrid und Hubert

Name: Gorazio
Reviews: Хочу поблагодарить Роберто и всю его семью на хорошие апартаменты и помощь в организации нашего пребывания в Риве. Они с полным пониманием и вниманием отнеслись к просьбе помочь организовать вечеринку по случаю моего дня рождления на 50 человек в саде их виллы. Сами заказали столы и скамьи и предоставили кухню в полное распоряжение. Провери наружное освещение над столами. Сами апартаменты реально новые-новые. Только закончился ремонт. Все на месте и работает. Терасса нереально оргомная) почти как сами апартаменты. Было бы чуть теплее и с нее просто не уйти))) Пешком до центра около 25 минут не торопясь, на машине 7 минут, велосипедом - 10-12 минут. Район спокойный, не шумный. Наличие собственного сада - это мега плюс!
